template.name: Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2
template.description:
Template Net Citrix NetScaler NetScaler software releases 10.5 or later.
Author: Baki Burak Ogun Blog: https://burakogun.com Github: https://github.com/bakiburakogun Linkedin: https://www.linkedin.com/in/baki-burak-ogun

item.name: HA current state
item.description: State of the HA node, based on its health, in a high availability setup. Possible values are: UP Indicates that the node is accessible and can function as either a primary or secondary node. DISABLED Indicates that the high availability status of the node has been manually disabled. Synchronization and propagation cannot take place between the peer nodes. INIT Indicates that the node is in the process of becoming part of the high availability configuration. PARTIALFAIL Indicates that one of the high availability monitored interfaces has failed because of a card or link failure. This state triggers a failover. COMPLETEFAIL Indicates that all the interfaces of the node are unusable, because the interfaces on which high availability monitoring is enabled are not connected or are manually disabled. This state triggers a failover. DUMB Indicates that the node is in listening mode. It does not participate in high availability transitions or transfer configuration from the peer node. This is a configured value, not a statistic. PARTIALFAILSSL Indicates that the SSL card has failed. This state triggers a failover. ROUTEMONITORFAIL Indicates that the route monitor has failed. This state triggers a failover.

item.name: HA current status
item.description: Whether a NetScaler appliance is configured for high availability. Possible values are YES and NO. If the value is NO, the high availability statistics below are invalid.

item.name: HA sync failures
item.description: Number of times the configuration of the primary and secondary nodes failed to synchronize since that last transition. A synchronization failure results in mismatched configuration. It can be caused by a mismatch in the Remote Procedural Call (RPC) password on the two nodes forming the high availability pair.

item.name: HA last master state transition reason
item.description: The reason for the last master state transition. This gives the conditions under which this node assumed the current state. The current state is available at the oid sysHighAvailabilityMode.0

item.name: HA peer state
item.description: This represents the state of the failover peer NetScaler whether Primary or Secondary

item.name: HA time of last state transition
item.description: This represents the time since the NetScaler underwent a state change from primary to secondary or vice-versa

item.name: HTTP/1.1 requests received
item.description: Total number of HTTP/1.1 requests received.

item.name: HTTP/1.1 responses sent
item.description: Total number of HTTP/1.1 responses sent.

item.name: Total HTTP GET requests received
item.description: Total number of HTTP requests received with the GET method.

item.name: Total HTTP others requests received
item.description: Total number of HTTP requests received with methods other than GET and POST. Some of the other well-defined HTTP methods are HEAD, PUT, DELETE, OPTIONS, and TRACE. User-defined methods are also allowed.

item.name: Total HTTP POST requests received
item.description: Total number of HTTP requests received with the POST method.

item.name: Total HTTP requests received
item.description: Total number of HTTP requests received.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: Total amount of system memory, in megabytes.

item.name: Memory utilization
item.description: Percentage of memory utilization on NetScaler.

item.name: Active server connections
item.description: Connections to a server currently responding to requests.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Clients
item_prototype.description: The total number of established client connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} Total Servers
item_prototype.description: The total number of established server connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} RxBytesRate
item_prototype.description: The total number of established client connections.

item_prototype.name: Vserver {#SNMPVALUE} TxBytesRate
item_prototype.description: This represents the response rate in bytes per second for this service/vserver.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<100 and {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}>0 and ({Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0
trigger_prototype.name: vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are degraded: {ITEM.VALUE1}
trigger_prototype.description: Le vserver a des services associés mais tous ne répondent pas.

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.health.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}=0 and ({Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesDown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesTransToOutOfSvc.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUnKnown.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()} + {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:vsvr.vsvrCurServicesUp.[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()})>0
trigger_prototype.name: vServer {#SNMPVALUE} services are down
trigger_prototype.description: Tous les services associés au vserver sont inactifs.

trigger.expression: {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haTimeofLastStateTransition.last()}<3600
trigger.name: Netscaler has failovered {ITEM.VALUE2} ago

trigger.expression: {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haCurState.last()}<>3
trigger.name: Netscaler HA state is down

trigger.expression: {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haCurStatus.last()}=1 and {Template Net Citrix NetScaler SNMPv2:haErrSyncFailure.diff(1h)}=1
trigger.name: Netscaler HA sync failure
